msContents.summary: I) Maṣḥafa taklil “Book of the Marriage Ritual” (fols. 3r-32v) - Prayers on the clothes (fols. 3ra-6ra l.15) - Prayers on the bride and the bridegroom (fols. 6ra l.15-30rb l.17) - Order to be read to the bride and the bridegroom (fols. 30rb l.17-32rb) Additio 1.

msItem.title: Maṣḥafa taklil “The Book of the Marriage Ritual”
msItem.incipit: 3ra, l.1:በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ፡ ንቀድም፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ጸሒፈ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ተክሊል፡ ዘውእቱ፡ ሕገ፡ ሰብሳብ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ውእቱ፡ ቀዳማዊ፡ ጸሎት፡ ዘይትነበብ፡ ላዕለ፡ አልባሰ፡ መርዓዊ፡ ወመርዓት፨[3ra, l.1]: In the name of the Father, the Son and the Holy Spirit, One God. Let us commence, with God’s help, to write the Book of the Crowning which is the ritual of marriage. This is the first prayer which is read over the garments of the bridegroom and bride.
msItem.explicit: 32ra, l.13: ይበል፡ ካህን፡ ዘቀደሰ። ድኅረ፡ ጸሎተ፡ መባእ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ አምላክነ፡ ዘሖርከ። ውስተ፡ ከብካብ፡ እስከ፡ ተፍጻሜቱ።።።[32ra, l.13]: Let the celebrant priest recite after the prayer of the offering: “Christ our God who went to the wedding…” up to the end.

msItem.note: The text includes the following smaller textual units: 1) Prayers on the clothes: The first prayer. Includes Our Father, reading from 1 Cor. 1:1-10, Trisagion, Mǝsbak (P84:11-12) and Gospel reading (Jn. 1:1-17) (3ra, l.10 – 6ra, l.15; Chaîne (ed.), 254 (text), 255 (transl.)) 2) The second prayer (6ra, l.15 – 6vb, l.7; Chaîne (ed.), 256 (text), 257 (transl.)) 3) The third prayer (6vb, l.7 – 8ra, l.2; Chaîne (ed.), 256 (text), 257 (transl.)) 4) The fourth prayer. Includes the prayer of Thanksgiving (8ra, l.3 – 9ra, l.10; Chaîne (ed.), 258 (text), 259 (transl.)) 5) The fifth prayer (9ra, l.10 – 10ra, l.4; Chaîne (ed.), 258 (text), 259 (transl.)) 6) Prayers on the bride and the bridegroom: the sixth prayer (10ra, l.4 – 11ra, l.6; Chaîne (ed.), 260 (text), 261 (transl.)) 7) Prayer, designated as “another prayer which is recited over the marriage”. Includes reading from Eph. 5:22-6:3, Qǝdmä Wängel (P18:6; 127:3), Gospel reading (Mt. 19:1-6) and the Creed (11ra, l.7 – 13ra, l.12; Chaîne (ed.), 260 (text), 261 (transl.)) 8) The seventh prayer (13ra, l.12 – 14vb, l.1). Corresponds to the second part of the seventh prayer in Chaîne (ed.), 262 (text), 263 (transl.) 9) The eighth prayer, not numbered (14vb, l.1 – 15va, l.6; Chaîne (ed.), 264 (text), 265 (transl.)) 10) The ninth prayer (15va, l.6 – 16vb, l.10; Chaîne (ed.), 264 (text), 265 (transl.)) 11) The tenth prayer (16vb, l.11 – 21ra, l.16). Includes prayer over the ointment, not inscribed as such (18vb, l.1 – 21ra, l.16; Chaîne (ed.), 266 (text), 267 (transl.)) 12) The eleventh prayer (21ra, l.17 – 21vb, l.9; Chaîne (ed.), 270 (text), 271 (transl.)) 13) Anointing of the bridegroom and bride; putting on sacramental garments (21vb, l.9 – 24rb, l.9; Chaîne (ed.), 270 (text), 271 (transl.)). Incipit of the text not rubricated. 14) Prayer of the benediction, containing biblical passages referring to marriage (24rb, l.9 – 27rb, l.2; Chaîne (ed.), 274 (text), 275 (transl.)) 15) Joining of the hands and blessing of the bridegroom and bride (27rb, l.2 – 30rb, l.16; Chaîne (ed.), 276 (text), 277 (transl.)) 16) Order to be read to the bride and the bridegroom: Prayer (tǝʾǝzaz) over the crowns. Includes P50, reading from 1 Tim. 4:9-16 and Gospel reading (Jn. 1:14-17) (30rb, l.17 – 31va, l.15; Chaîne (ed.), 280 (text), 281(transl.)) 17) Supplications for peace, for the metropolitan and the congregation, the Creed and the concluding prayers (31va, l.16 – 32rb, l.3; Chaîne (ed.), 282 (text), 283 (transl.)).

[34r]: On Sane 9, in the 44th year of mercy, I, Gabra Masqal Nǝguse, sold this Book of the Marriage Ritual to priest Haddisu Walda Māryām. The guarantor (of this) is lǝǧ Gabra Māryām Dämmäqä; the judge (dañña) is priest Gabra ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer Mazgaba (from) ʾAddi Grat. We swear by Ḫayla Śǝllāse’s death. Its price is 15 (Bǝrr).
item.note: In Amharic, crudely written in pen (?). The purchase took place on June 16, 1952. ይመ is the abbreviation for ይሙት፡.
